title: Standard Form
text: Standard form has $$r$$ isolated on one side of the equation, with a $$1$$ as the constant in the denominator. We have to isolate $$r$$.

title: Convert to Standard Form
text: Divide both sides by $$7+8costheta$$ to isolate $$r$$.

title: Convert to Standard Form
text: Divide numerator and denominator by the constant in the denominator, $$7$$.

title: Directrix
text: cosθ is in the denominator, so the directrix is $$x=±p$$.

title: Eccentricity
text: Eccentricity is the coefficient in front of the sinθ or cosθ in the denominator, which is $$\frac{8}{7}$$.

title: Identify
text: If $$0 \leq e<1$$, the conic is an ellipse. If $$e=1$$, the conic is a parabola. If $$e>1$$, the conic is a hyperbola.

title: Directrix
text: The numerator in a conic is the product of the eccentricity and the directrix. So, the directrix is $$x=\frac{1}{\frac{8}{7}}=\frac{7}{8}$$
